CatDescriptText: Cutline of related image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, national edition, July 4, 1942, pg. 10, reads: "Weddings in June... No.14 - Mr. and Mrs. George Edward Webster of Pittsburgh.  Both are Pittsburgh Courier employees.  Wedding was held Saturday at Metropolitan Baptist church.  Bridal party included, left to right: Miss Marie Maze of Sewickley, Lawrence Nixon, Miss Blanche Woodson, Mrs. Leroi Bannister, sister of the bride and matron of honor; Roger Thomas, the bride, the former Mary Louisa Jeffries, Courier's telephone switchboard operator; the groom, Mr. Webster; William Webster, brother of the groom and best man; Miss Marian Lee Bannister, niece of the bride; Leroi Bannister, Miss Esther Ringgold, Robert Lavelle and Miss Lydia Taylor.  The little ones standing in the front row are: Mildred Webster, flower girl; Russell Goode, ringbearer, and Charmaine Jeffries, flower girl. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Wedding party for Webster - Jeffries wedding, including Marie Maze, Blanche Woodson, matron of honor Marian Bannister, bride Mary Louise Jeffries Webster, Ms. Bannister, Esther Ringgold, Lydia Taylor, and flower girls Mildred Webster and Charmaine Jeffries, posed in yard
